unnormalised: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has announced updates regarding the integration of various government-issued identity documents with the DigiLocker platform. As of 2024-07-26, citizens can now access and digitally verify their PAN cards, Aadhaar cards, and Voter IDs directly through the app. This initiative aims to streamline identity verification processes for availing various government services.
normalised: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (M-e-i-t-Y) has announced updates regarding the integration of various government-issued identity documents with the DigiLocker platform. As of twenty sixth july two thousand and twenty four, citizens can now access and digitally verify their P-A-N cards, Aadhaar cards, and Voter I-Ds directly through the app. This initiative aims to streamline identity verification processes for availing various government services.

unnormalised: According to a press release issued earlier today, the integration will significantly reduce the need for physical documents. For example, citizens applying for a new phone connection will no longer need to submit a physical copy of their Aadhaar, provided it’s linked to their DigiLocker account. The UIDAI-issued Aadhaar No. 9876-5432-1012, belonging to Mr. R. Kumar, was successfully verified during a pilot program.

unnormalised: Furthermore, MeitY officials stated that the platform is equipped with robust security measures to prevent data breaches and misuse. The platform employs end-to-end encryption and stringent access controls to safeguard user information. The integration includes support for various formats of identification documents, including the PAN card (e.g., ABCDE1234F), driving license (e.g., DL-1234567890), and passport (e.g., Z1234567).

unnormalised: The DigiLocker platform has witnessed a significant increase in user adoption since its inception. As of June 30th, 2024, over 150 million citizens have registered on the platform and are actively using it to store and access their digital documents. Officials anticipate that this recent integration will further boost the platform's usage and contribute to a more efficient and transparent governance system.

unnormalised: Citizens are encouraged to link their government-issued identity documents to their DigiLocker accounts to take full advantage of the platform's features. The Ministry plans to roll out similar integrations for other essential documents, such as property registration papers and insurance policies, in the near future. Further announcements are expected by Q4 2024.
